pr_title: CUSTCOM-205 On ZuluJDK 8.44, accessing HTTPS throws NoSuchMethodError exception

timeline.message: CUSTCOM-205 On ZuluJDK 8.44, accessing HTTPS gives NoSuchMethodError

timeline.bodyText: Is this JAR actually activated anywhere?
timeline.author: MattGill98
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,11 @@
                                     <destFileName>grizzly-npn-bootstrap.jar</destFileName>
                                 </artifactItem>
                                 <!-- Other versioned NPN Bootstrap Jars referenced in new domain.xml (since 5.184) -->
+                                  <artifactItem>

replies.bodyText: We agreed with @MeroRai that the JAR file won't be activated automatically and will only be available if users want to use the latest Zulu JDK. They would have to modify JVM options to use this version of the NPN library. This should be documented in the docs.
replies.author: OndroMih

timeline.bodyText: Are grizzly npn changes being pushed back upstream to Grizzly. Ideally we would patch here then get it into a Grizzly release ASAP
timeline.author: smillidge
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,11 @@
                                     <destFileName>grizzly-npn-bootstrap.jar</destFileName>
                                 </artifactItem>
                                 <!-- Other versioned NPN Bootstrap Jars referenced in new domain.xml (since 5.184) -->
+                                  <artifactItem>
+                                    <groupId>org.glassfish.grizzly</groupId>
+                                    <artifactId>grizzly-npn-bootstrap</artifactId>
+                                    <version>1.9.payara-p1</version>

replies.bodyText: AFAIK, the latest version of Grizzly NPN contains support for the latest version of OpenJDK, so it's equal to our latest version of Grizzly. However, Grizzly NPN is designed to support only a single version of the JDK security classes so this fix would only be accepted after OpenJDK is updated with the same changes as the latest Zulu version. Azul claim their going to push this change to OpenJDK in the following months.
replies.author: OndroMih
